a.g: I swear by the Day of Resurrection
And I swear by the reproaching soul [to the certainty of resurrection].
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال الحسن في قوله تعالى ولا أقسم بالنفس اللوامة قال لا يلقى المؤمن إلا يعاتب نفسه ماذا أردت بكلمتي ماذا أردت بأكلتي ماذا أردت بشربتي والفاجر يمضى قدما لا يعاتب نفسه
And indeed, al-Hasan [al-Basri], concerning His, the Exalted's, saying: "And I swear by the self-reproaching soul [al-nafs al-lawwama]," said: "The believer [al-mu'min] is not met except that he reproaches his own soul [nafs]: 'What did you intend with your word? What did you intend with your food? What did you intend with your drink?' As for the wicked one [al-fajir], he proceeds forward, not reproaching his own soul [nafs]."

a.g: Does man think that We will not assemble his bones?
Yes. [We are] Able [even] to proportion his fingertips.
But man desires to continue in sin.
He asks, "When is the Day of Resurrection?"
So when vision is dazzled
And the moon darkens
And the sun and the moon are joined,
Man will say on that Day, "Where is the [place of] escape?"
No! There is no refuge.
To your Lord, that Day, is the [place of] permanence.
Man will be informed that Day of what he sent ahead and kept back.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وفي مثله قوله تعالى ينبأ الإنسان يومئذ بما قدم وأخر وإنما أخر آثار أعماله من سنة سيئة عمل بها غيره
Indeed, in its likeness is the saying of the Almighty: "Man will be informed on that Day of what he sent ahead and what he left behind [mā qaddama wa akhkhar]." And what he left behind [akhkhar] are the effects of his deeds—from a corrupt practice [sunnah sayyi'ah] that he performed, which others then followed.

a.g: Rather, man, against himself, will be a witness,
Even if he presents his excuses.
Move not your tongue with it, [O Muhammad], to hasten with recitation of the Qur'an.
Indeed, upon Us is its collection [in your heart] and [to make possible] its recitation.
So when We have recited it [through Gabriel], then follow its recitation.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وكما قال تعالى: " فإذا قرأناه فاتبع قرآنه " قيل في التفسير: معناه إذا قرأه عليك جبريل.
Indeed, as the Exalted has said: "So when We have recited it [qara'nahu], then follow its recitation [qur'anahu]." It is said in the interpretation [tafsir]: Its meaning is when Gabriel [Jibril] recites it to you.

a.g: Then upon Us is its clarification [to you].
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وأراد به العلم وقال تعالى فاسألوا أهل الذكر إن كنتم لا تعلمون وقال تعالى إن علينا للهدى وقال ثم إن علينا بيانه وقال وعلى الله قصد السبيل
Indeed, I intended by it knowledge [al-'ilm]. And Allah, the Exalted, said: "So ask the people of the Remembrance [ahl al-dhikr] if you do not know." And He, the Exalted, said: "Indeed, upon Us is guidance [al-huda]." And He said: "Then indeed, upon Us is its clarification [bayanuhu]." And He said: "And upon Allah is the direction of the path [qasd al-sabil]."

a.g: No! But you love the immediate
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ولما استطار مكر الشيطان في كافة الخلق ارسل الله الملائكة الى الرسل وأوحوا إليهم ما تم على الخلق من اهلاك العدو واغوائه فاشتغلوا بدعوة الخلق الى الملك الحقيقي عن الملك المجازي الذي لا اصل له ان سلم ولا دوام له اصلا فنادوا فيهم ﴿ يا ايها الذين امنوا ما لكم اذا قيل لكم انفروا في سبيل الله اثاقلتم الى الارض أرضيتم بالحياة الدنيا من الاخرة فما متاع الحياة الدنيا في الاخرة الا قليل ﴾ {} فالتوراة والانجيل والزبور والفرقان وصحف موسى وابراهيم وكل كتاب منزل ما أنزل إلالدعوة الخلق الى الملك الدائم المخلد والمراد منهم ان يكونوا ملوكا في الدنيا ملوكا في الآخرة اما ملك الدنيا فالزهد فيها والقناعة باليسير منها واما ملك الآخرة فبالقرب من الله تعالى يدرك بقاء لا فناء فيه وعزا لا ذل فيه وقرة عين اخفيت في هذا العالم لا تعلمها نفس من النفوس والشيطان يدعوهم الى ملك الدنيا لعلمه بان ملك الاخرة يفوت به اذ الدنيا والاخرة ضرتان ولعلمه بأن الدنيا لا تسلم له ايضا ولو كانت تسلم له لكان يحسده ايضا ولكن ملك الدنيا لا يخلو عن المنازعات والمكدرات وطول الهموم في التدبيرات وكذا سائر اسباب الجاه ثم مهما تسلم وتتم الاسباب ينقضي العمر ﴿ حتى اذا اخذت الارض زخرفها وازينت وظن اهلها انهم قادرون عليها اتاها امرنا ليلا او نهارا فجعلناها حصيدا كأن لم تغن بالأمس ﴾ {} فضرب الله تعالى لها مثلا فقال تعالى: ﴿ واضرب لهم مثل الحياة الدنيا كماء انزلناه من السماء فاختلط به نبات الأرض فأصبح هشيما تذروه الرياح ﴾ {} والزهد في الدنيا لما ان كان ملكا حاضرا حسده الشيطان عليه فصده عنه ومعنى الزهد ان يملك العبد شهوته وغضبه فينقادان لباعث الدين واشارة
Indeed, when the cunning [makr] of Satan spread among all creation, God sent the angels to the messengers and revealed to them what had befallen creation from the enemy's destruction and misguidance. So they busied themselves with calling creation to the True Sovereign [al-Malik al-Haqiqi] over the metaphorical sovereign [al-Malik al-Majazi] which has no foundation if it is safe, nor any permanence at all. So they called out among them: **"O you who have believed, what is [the matter] with you that when it is said to you, 'Go forth in the cause of God,' you are heavily inclined toward the earth? Are you satisfied with the life of this world [al-hayat al-dunya] from the Hereafter [al-Akhira]? But what is the enjoyment of the life of this world compared to the Hereafter except a little."** (9:38) So the Torah, the Gospel, the Psalms, the Criterion [al-Furqan], the Scrolls of Moses and Abraham, and every revealed Book was sent down for nothing but to call creation to the enduring, everlasting Sovereign, and the intent for them is that they be sovereigns in this world [al-dunya] and sovereigns in the Hereafter [al-Akhira]. As for sovereignty in this world, it is through asceticism [zuhd] in it and contentment with the little of it. And as for sovereignty in the Hereafter, it is through nearness to God, the Most High, attained by a permanence [baqa'] in which there is no annihilation, and a might ['izz] in which there is no humiliation, and a coolness of the eye [qurrat 'ayn] concealed in this world [al-'alam] which no soul [nafs] among the souls knows. And Satan calls them to sovereignty in this world, knowing that sovereignty in the Hereafter is lost by it, for this world and the Hereafter are co-wives, and knowing that this world will not be safe for him either—and even if it were safe for him, he would envy it also—but sovereignty in this world is not free from disputes, disturbances, the length of cares in management, and likewise all the causes of status. Then, however much it is safe and the causes are complete, the lifespan ends: **"Until when the earth has taken on its adornment and is beautified and its people think that they are capable of it, Our command comes to it by night or by day, and We make it as a harvest, as if it had not flourished yesterday."** (10:24) So God, the Most High, struck a parable for it, saying, the Most High: **"And present to them the example of the life of this world [al-hayat al-dunya] as [like] water which We send down from the sky, and the vegetation of the earth mingles with it; then it becomes dry remnants, scattered by the winds."** (18:45) And asceticism [zuhd] in this world, since it is a present sovereignty, Satan envied it and turned him away from it. And the meaning of asceticism is that the servant [al-'abd] masters his passion [shahwa] and his anger [ghadab], so they submit to the motive of religion and its indication.

a.g: And leave the Hereafter.
[Some] faces, that Day, will be radiant,
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
الأصل التاسع: العلم بأنه تعالى مع كونه منزها عن الصورة والمقدار مقدسا عن الجهات والأقطار مرئي بالأعين والأبصار في الدار الآخرة دار القرار لقوله تعالى وجوه يومئذ ناضرة إلى ربها ناظرة ولا يرى في الدنيا تصديقا لقوله عز وجل لا تدركه الأبصار وهو يدرك الأبصار ولقوله تعالى في خطاب موسى عليه السلام لن تراني وليت شعري كيف عرف المعتزل من صفات رب الأرباب ما جهله موسى عليه السلام وكيف سأل موسى عليه السلام الرؤية مع كونها محالا ولعل الجهل بذوي البدع والأهواء من الجهلة الأغبياء أولى من الجهل بالأنبياء صلوات الله عليهم وأما وجه إجراء آية الرؤية على الظاهر فهو أنه غير مؤد إلى المحال فإن الرؤية نوع كشف وعلم إلا أنه أتم وأوضح من العلم فإذا جاز تعلق العلم به وليس في جهة جاز تعلق الرؤية به وليس بجهة وكما يجوز أن يرى الله تعالى الخلق وليس في مقابلتهم جاز أن يراه الخلق من غير مقابلة وكما جاز أن يعلم من غير كيفية وصورة جاز أن يرى كذلك.
Indeed, the ninth foundation: the knowledge [ma'rifa] that He, the Exalted, while being sanctified from form [surah] and dimension [miqdar], purified from directions [jihat] and spatial confines [aqtar], is seen [mura'i] by the eyes [a'yun] and the sights [absar] in the Abode of the Hereafter [Dar al-Akhirah], the Abode of Permanence [Dar al-Qarar], due to His saying, the Exalted: "Faces [wujuh] on that day will be radiant, looking [nazirah] at their Lord [Rabb]" (75:22-23). And He is not seen in this world [dunya], confirming His saying, Mighty and Majestic: "Eyesights [absar] do not perceive Him, yet He perceives eyesights" (6:103), and due to His saying, the Exalted, in His address to Musa, peace be upon him: "You will not see Me" (7:143). And I wonder how the Mu'tazilite presumed to know from the attributes [sifat] of the Lord of lords what Musa, peace be upon him, was ignorant of, and how could Musa, peace be upon him, ask for the vision [ru'yah] while it is impossible? Perhaps ignorance is more fitting for the people of innovation [bid'ah] and caprice [ahwa'] from among the ignorant fools than it is for the Prophets, may the prayers of God be upon them. As for the manner of applying the verse of vision [ayah al-ru'yah] according to its apparent meaning [zahir], it is that it does not lead to impossibility, for vision [ru'yah] is a type of unveiling [kashf] and knowledge ['ilm], except that it is more complete and clearer than knowledge. So, if it is permissible for knowledge to be related to Him while He is not in a direction [jihat], then it is permissible for vision [ru'yah] to be related to Him while He is not in a direction. And just as it is permissible for God, the Exalted, to see the creation [khalq] while not being opposite them, it is permissible for the creation to see Him without opposition. And just as it is permissible to know Him without modality [kayfiyyah] or form [surah], it is permissible to see Him likewise.

a.g: Looking at their Lord.
And [some] faces, that Day, will be contorted,
Expecting that there will be done to them [something] backbreaking.
No! When the soul has reached the collar bones
And it is said, "Who will cure [him]?"
And the dying one is certain that it is the [time of] separation
And the leg is wound about the leg,
To your Lord, that Day, will be the procession.
And the disbeliever had not believed, nor had he prayed.
But [instead], he denied and turned away.
And then he went to his people, swaggering [in pride].
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال مجاهد في قوله تعالى "ثم ذهب إلى أهله يتمطى" أي يتبختر وإذ قد ذكرنا ذم الكبر والاختيال فلنذكر فضيلة التواضع والله تعالى أعلم.
Indeed, Mujahid said regarding His, the Exalted's, saying, "Then he went to his family, walking proudly [yatmatta']" – meaning, strutting boastfully. And since We have mentioned the censure of arrogance [kibr] and swaggering [ikhtiyal], then let Us mention the virtue of humility [tawadu']. And Allah, the Exalted, knows best.

a.g: Woe to you, and woe!
Then woe to you, and woe!
Does man think that he will be left neglected?
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى: ﴿ أيحسب الإنسان أن يترك سدى ألم يك نطفة من منى يمنى ثم كان علقة فخلق فسوى فجعل منه الزوجين الذكر والأنثى ﴾ ففى خلق الآدمى مع كثرة عجائبه واختلاف تركيب أعضائه أعاجيب تزيد على الأعاجيب فى بعثه وإعادته فكيف ينكر ذلك من قدرة الله تعالى وحكمته من يشاهد ذلك فى صنعته وقدرته فإن كان فى إيمانك ضعف فقو الإيمان بالنظر فى النشأة الأولى فإن الثانية مثلها وأسهل منها
Indeed, does man [al-insan] reckon he will be left neglected [suda]? Was he not a drop of sperm [nutfah] emitted [yumna]? Then he became a clinging clot ['alaqah], then He created and proportioned. Then He made from him the two mates, the male and the female. In the creation of the human being [al-adami], despite the multitude of its wonders and the differing composition of its limbs, are wonders that surpass the wonders in his resurrection [ba'th] and his restoration [i'adatuhu]. So how can one who witnesses that in His making [san'atihi] and His power [qudratihi] deny that from the power [qudrah] of God, the Exalted, and His wisdom [hikmatihi]? If there is weakness in your faith [iman], then strengthen faith [al-iman] by looking into the first genesis [al-nash'ah al-ula], for the second is like it and easier than it.

a.g: Had he not been a sperm from semen emitted?
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى ألم يك نطفة من منى يمنى ثم كان علقة فخلق فسوى فتكرير ذكر النطفة في الكتاب العزيز ليس ليسمع لفظه ويترك التفكر في معناه فانظر الآن إلى النطفة وهي قطرة من الماء قذرة لو تركت ساعة ليضربها الهواء فسدت وانتنت كيف أخرجها رب الأرباب من الصلب والترائب وكيف جمع بين الذكر والأنثى وألقى الألفة والمحبة في قلوبهم وكيف قادهم بسلسلة المحبة والشهوة الى الاجتماع وكيف استخرج النطفة من الرجل بحركة الوقاع وكيف استجلب دم الحيض من أعماق العروق وجمعه في الرحم ثم كيف خلق المولود من النطفة وسقاه بماء الحيض وغذاه حتى نما وربا وكبر وكيف جعل النطفة وهي بيضاء مشرقة علقة حمراء ثم كيف جعلها مضغة ثم كيف قسم أجزاء النطفة وهي متساوية متشابهة إلى العظام والأعصاب والعروق والأوتار واللحم ثم كيف ركب من اللحوم والأعصاب والعروق الأعضاء الظاهرة فدور الرأس وشق السمع والبصر والأنف والفم وسائر المنافذ ثم مد اليد والرجل وقسم رءوسها بالأصابع وقسم الأصابع بالأنامل ثم كيف ركب الأعضاء الباطنة من القلب والمعدة والكبد والطحال والرئة والرحم والمثانة والأمعاء كل واحد على شكل مخصوص ومقدار مخصوص لعمل مخصوص ثم كيف قسم كل عضو من هذه الأعضاء بأقسام أخر فركب العين من سبع طبقات لكل طبقة وصف مخصوص وهيئة مخصوصة لو فقدت طبقة منها أو زالت صفة من صفاتها تعطلت العين عن الإبصار فانظر الآن إلى العظام وهي أجسام صلبة قوية كيف خلقها من نطفة سخيفة رقيقة ثم جعلها قواما للبدن وعمادا له ثم قدرها بمقادير مختلفة وأشكال مختلفة
Indeed, was he not a drop of sperm [nutfah] emitted? Then he became a clinging clot [‘alaqah]; then He created and proportioned [fasawwa]. The repeated mention of the sperm-drop [nutfah] in the Mighty Book is not for you to hear its word and abandon reflection upon its meaning. So look now at the sperm-drop [nutfah]—it is a droplet of foul water; if left for an hour for the air to strike it, it would spoil and become putrid. How did the Lord of lords bring it forth from the loins and the ribs? And how did He bring together the male and the female, and cast affection [ulfah] and love [mahabbah] into their hearts [qulub]? And how did He lead them by the chain of love [mahabbah] and desire [shahwah] to union? And how did He extract the sperm-drop [nutfah] from the man by the movement of intercourse? And how did He draw the blood of menstruation from the depths of the veins and gather it in the womb? Then how did He create the child from the sperm-drop [nutfah] and nourish it with the water of menstruation and feed it until it grew, increased, and became large? And how did He make the sperm-drop [nutfah], which is white and shining, into a red clinging clot [‘alaqah]? Then how did He make it a chewed lump [mudghah]? Then how did He divide the parts of the sperm-drop [nutfah], which are equal and similar, into bones, nerves, veins, tendons, and flesh? Then how did He construct from the flesh, nerves, and veins the outward limbs: the roundness of the head, the splitting of hearing and sight, the nose, the mouth, and all the openings? Then He extended the hand and the leg, and divided their ends into fingers, and divided the fingers into fingertips. Then how did He construct the inward limbs: the heart [qalb], the stomach, the liver, the spleen, the lung, the womb, the bladder, and the intestines—each one with a specific form and a specific measure for a specific function? Then how did He divide each of these limbs into other divisions? He constructed the eye from seven layers; for each layer is a specific attribute and a specific configuration. If a single layer from them were lost, or an attribute from its attributes were removed, the eye would be incapacitated from sight. So look now at the bones—they are solid, strong bodies—how did He create them from a lowly, delicate sperm-drop [nutfah]? Then He made them the framework [qiwam] for the body and its support [‘amad]. Then He proportioned them with different measures and different forms.

a.g: Then he was a clinging clot, and [Allah] created [his form] and proportioned [him]
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ثم ذكر منته عليه فقال "فخلق فسوى فجعل منه الزوجين الذكر والأنثى" ليدوم وجوده بالتناسل كما حصل وجوده أولاً بالاختراع.
Then He mentioned His favor upon him, saying: "Then He created and proportioned, and made from him the two spouses, the male and the female," so that his existence [wujud] would endure through procreation [tanasul], just as his existence was first obtained through origination [ikhtira'].

a.g: And made of him two mates, the male and the female.
Is not that [Creator] Able to give life to the dead?
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ويحك يا نفس كأنك لا تؤمنين بيوم الحساب وتظنين أنك إذا مت انفلت وتخلصت وهيهات أتحسبين أنك تتركين سدى ألم تكونى نطفة من منى يمنى ثم كنت علقة فخلق فسوى أليس ذلك بقادر على أن يحيى الموتى فإن كان هذا من إضمارك فما أكفرك وأجهلك أما تتفكرين أنه مماذا خلقك من نطفة خلقك فقدرك ثم السبيل يسرك ثم أماتك فأقبرك أفتكذبينه في قوله ثم إذا شاء أنشرك فإن لم تكونى مكذبة فما لك لا تأخذين حذرك
Indeed, woe unto you, O soul [nafs]! It is as if you do not believe in the Day of Reckoning [yawm al-hisab], and you imagine that when you die, you will escape and be free. How far-fetched! Do you reckon you will be left in vain [suda]? Were you not a drop of sperm [nutfah] from semen poured forth? Then you were a clinging clot ['alaqah], then He created and proportioned you? Is not That One capable of reviving the dead? If this is from your hidden thoughts, then how faithless [akfar] and ignorant [ajhal] you are! Do you not reflect upon that from which He created you—from a sperm-drop [nutfah] He created you, then destined you [qaddaraka], then eased the way for you, then caused you to die and buried you? Do you then deny Him in His saying, "Then when He wills, He will resurrect you"? If you are not a denier, then why do you not take your precaution?
